  VP_RGB24 = 7, VP_RGB32 = 8, VP_YUV400 = 9, VP_YUV422 = 10,
  VP_TOTAL = 11
}

enum  vp_target_e {
  VP_Y = 1, VP_U = 2, VP_V = 4, VP_UV = ((VP_U) | (VP_V)),
  VP_YUV = ((VP_UV) | (VP_Y))
}

enum  vp_filter_type_e {
  VP_BLUR3x3 = 0x10, VP_BLUR5x5 = 0x11, VP_SHARPEN3x3 = 0x20, VP_SHARPEN5x5 = 0x21,
  VP_MEDIAN3x3 = 0x30, VP_MEDIAN5x3 = 0x31, VP_TEMPORAL_DENOISE = 0x40, VP_TELECINE = 0x50,
  VP_DEINTERLACE = 0x60, VP_RESIZE = 0x70, VP_COLORSPACE = 0x80, VP_POSTFILTER_2D = 0x90,
  VP_POSTFILTER_1D = 0x91
}

enum  vp_telecine_cmd_e {
  VP_DIRECT = 0, VP_OLD_FRAME = (VP_OLD_TOP_FIELD | VP_OLD_BOT_FIELD), VP_NEW_FRAME = (VP_NEW_TOP_FIELD | VP_NEW_BOT_FIELD), VP_NEW_TOP_OLD_BOT = (VP_NEW_TOP_FIELD | VP_OLD_BOT_FIELD),
  VP_OLD_TOP_NEW_BOT = (VP_OLD_TOP_FIELD | VP_NEW_BOT_FIELD)
}

Detailed Description

VSofts Video Processing Library public API.

Project: VSofts H.264 Codec V4

typedef long VPAPI vp_data_callback_f(void *ctx, void *data, long size)

callback function declaration

Parameters:
ctx - application-defined context;
data - data buffer to write to / read from;
size - number of bytes to process;
Returns:
number of bytes processed;

Definition at line 91 of file vp.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum vp_colorspace_e

colorspace specification

Enumerator:
VP_UNKNOWN 
VP_IYUV  YUV 4:2:0 planar (our internal).
VP_YV12  YUV 4:2:0 planar (U&V swapped).
VP_YUY2  YUV 4:2:2 packed.
VP_YVYU  YUV 4:2:2 packed.
VP_UYVY  YUV 4:2:2 packed.
VP_RGB555  RGB 5:5:5.
VP_RGB565  RGB 5:6:5.
VP_RGB24  RGB 24 bit.
VP_RGB32  RGB 24 bit + alpha channel.
VP_YUV400  YUV 4:0:0 planar.
VP_YUV422  YUV 4:2:2 planar.
VP_TOTAL  total number of color spaces

Definition at line 44 of file vp.h.

enum vp_deinterlace_type_e

deinterlacing types

Enumerator:
VP_NO_DEINTERLACE 
VP_DEINTERLACE_TOP  copy data from top field to bottom
VP_DEINTERLACE_BOTTOM  copy data from bottom field to top
VP_DEINTERLACE_ADAPTIVE  modify bottom field to minimize "interlace" artifacts

Definition at line 295 of file vp.h.

int VPAPI vp_add_colorspace ( vp_batch_t  batch,
vp_colorspace_e  colorspace 
)

add a colorspace conversion to the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
colorspace - specify target colorspace;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_add_deinterlace ( vp_batch_t  batch,
vp_deinterlace_type_e  type 
)

deinterlace can be added only if batch was open with interlace flag otherwise error code will be return add deinterlace operation to the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
type - type of deinterlace operation;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_add_filter ( vp_batch_t  batch,
vp_target_e  target,
vp_filter_type_e  type,
int  param0,
int  param1 
)

add a filter to the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
target - specify part of the image to apply filtering to;
type - type of filter;
param0 - first filter parameter;
param1 - second filter parameter;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_add_resize ( vp_batch_t  batch,
int  width,
int  height 
)

add resize operation to the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
width - target image width, pixels;
height - target image height, pixels;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_add_resize_ex ( vp_batch_t  batch,
int  width,
int  height,
int  grid_position_x,
int  grid_position_denom_x,
int  grid_position_y,
int  grid_position_denom_y,
int  quality 
)

add resize operation to the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
width - target image width, pixels;
height - target image height, pixels;
grid_position_x - horisontal phase
grid_position_y - vertical phase
grid_position_denom_x - horisontal grid possition accuracy
grid_position_denom_y - vertical grid possition accuracy
quality - (2-8) speed/quality tradeoff parameter: 2 - max speed; 8 - max quality
Returns:
VP result grid_position_x and grid_position_y specify the horizontal and vertical location of the upper left sample of resized frame to the upper left sample of original frame in units of (1/grid_position_denom) of the luma sample grid spacing between the samples of original frame if grid_position_denom is zero, sample location is calculated automatically in order to preserve center-of-gravity of original and resized picture in the same position.

int VPAPI vp_add_telecine ( vp_batch_t  batch  ) 

prepare for further telecine operation in the batch;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_bit_depth ( vp_batch_t *  batch,
int  y_bit_depth,
int  u_bit_depth,
int  v_bit_depth 
)

set bit depth;

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
y_bit_depth - Y-plane bit depth;
u_bit_depth - U-plane bit depth;
v_bit_depth - V-plane bit depth;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_close ( vp_batch_t  batch  ) 

close (free) batch instance;

int VPAPI vp_get_config ( vp_batch_t  batch,
char *  cfg 
)

get config returns batch configuration if cfg param equals zero then return value is the size of batch configuration if return value is negative then it is VP result otherwise it is configuration size if cfg param non zero then function writes configuration to cfg pointer retrun VP reslut

int VPAPI vp_init_frame_factory ( vp_frame_factory_t *  factory,
int  width,
int  height,
vp_colorspace_e  colorspace,
void *  caller_context,
vp_data_callback_f *  read_data,
vp_data_callback_f *  write_data 
)

initialize frame factory instance for further frame operations;

Parameters:
factory - instance to be created;
width - frame width, pixels;
height - frame height, pixels;
colorspace - frame colorspace specification;
caller_context - optional caller data to be passed in callbacks;
read_data - caller callback function to read frame data;
write_data - caller callback function to write frame data;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_init_frame_factory_ex ( vp_frame_factory_t *  factory,
int  width,
int  height,
int  bytes_per_pel,
vp_colorspace_e  colorspace,
void *  caller_context,
vp_data_callback_f *  read_data,
vp_data_callback_f *  write_data 
)

initialize frame factory instance with extra bit depth;

Parameters:
factory - instance to be created;
width - frame width, pixels;
height - frame height, pixels;
bytes_per_pel - number of bytes per pixel (default is "1");
colorspace - frame colorspace specification;
caller_context - optional caller data to be passed in callbacks;
read_data - caller callback function to read frame data;
write_data - caller callback function to write frame data;
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_open ( vp_batch_t *  batch,
vp_frame_t *  frame,
int  is_interlace 
)

create batch instance;

Parameters:
batch - instance to be created;
frame - source frame definition (width height colorspace);
is_interlace - interlace flag (0/1);
Returns:
VP result

int VPAPI vp_open_crop ( vp_batch_t *  batch,
vp_frame_t *  frame,
int  cr_left,
int  cr_top,
int  cr_width,
int  cr_height,
int  is_interlace 
)

create batch instance with cropping;

Parameters:
batch - instance to be created;
frame - source frame definition (width height colorspace);
cr_left - pixels to be cropped from the left;
cr_top - pixels to be cropped from the top;
cr_width - resulting width, pixels;
cr_height - resulting height, pixels;
is_interlace - interlace flag (0/1);
Returns:
VP result

vp_frame_t *  src,
vp_frame_t *  dst 
)

Parameters:
batch - batch instance created by any of vp_open();
src - source frame;
dst - destination frame;
Returns:
VP result
